cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest and then turning northwest, slowing and aiming for the north-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana / Mississippi shoreline)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Louisiana–Mississippi coast between Morgan City, LA and Ocean Springs, MS

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to the Alabama/Florida border; Hurricane Watch east of Ocean Springs, MS, to the Alabama/Florida border; Tropical Storm Watch Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA, to Ocean Springs, MS including Lake Pontchartrain and metro New Orleans; Storm Surge Warning Port Fourchon, LA, to the Mississippi/Alabama border including adjacent bays; Tropical Storm Warning east of Ocean Springs, MS, to Indian Pass, FL and Intracoastal City, LA, to west of Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late week; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤4% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the South Carolina coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–3 inches of rain to coastal South Carolina late Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes possible inland across the Southeast late week, but risk at Charleston is very low.
